gtfstools 0.0.0.9005
  • Reference

Merge GTFS files

Source: R/merge_gtfs.R
merge_gtfs.Rd

Combines many GTFS file into a single one and validates the resulting object.

merge_gtfs(..., files = NULL, quiet = TRUE, warnings = TRUE)

Arguments

...

GTFS objects, as created by read_gtfs, to be merged. Each argument can either be a GTFS or a list of GTFS objects.
files

A character vector listing the GTFS text files (i.e. the ones represented by data.tables) to be merged. If NULL (the default) all files are merged.
quiet

Whether to hide log messages (defaults to TRUE).
warnings

Whether to display warning messages (defaults to TRUE).

Value

Returns a GTFS object with an updated validation_result attribute.

See also

validate_gtfs

Examples

spo_path <- system.file("extdata/spo_gtfs.zip", package = "gtfstools")
poa_path <- system.file("extdata/poa_gtfs.zip", package = "gtfstools")

spo_gtfs <- read_gtfs(spo_path)
poa_gtfs <- read_gtfs(poa_path)

merge_gtfs(spo_gtfs, poa_gtfs)

#> $agency
#>    agency_id                                 agency_name
#> 1:         1                                     SPTRANS
#> 2:         1                                     SPTRANS
#> 3:      EPTC Empresa Publica de Transportes e Circulação
#>                                  agency_url   agency_timezone agency_lang
#> 1: http://www.sptrans.com.br/?versao=011019 America/Sao_Paulo          pt
#> 2: http://www.sptrans.com.br/?versao=011019 America/Sao_Paulo          pt

merge_gtfs(list(spo_gtfs, poa_gtfs))
